p: A total of 85 of 125 serum samples analyzed by ELISA were positive, which indicated an overall seroprevalence of 68.0% (95%CI 59.3–75.5). The prevalence was 77.2% (95%CI 63.0–87.1%) in white pigs (34/44), 63.0% (95%CI 48.6–75.4%) in Iberian pigs (29/46), and 62.8% (95%CI 46.3–76.8%) in wild boars (22/35). Of the 125 liver transudate samples, 77 tested positive when undiluted (61.6%, 95%CI 52.9–69.7%), 88 when diluted 1:2 (70.4%, 95%CI 61.9–77.7%), 71 when diluted 1:10 (56.8%, 95%CI 48.0–67.5%), and 56 when diluted 1:20 (44.8%, 95%CI 36.4–53.5%) ( Table 1).
